data.title: Good if you like kebabs
data.text:
We ate in the restaurant as the guys said it was to warm to sit outside.
Which we were glad of   as nice and cool inside.
Seems like a family business and the service and staff were friendly.
We both had  doner kebabs with fries and cokes and the food was nice and good value.
Will definetly return when in Scottsdale.

data.title: Excellent falafel platter
data.text: My daughter and I each had the falafel and some fries. Delicious. Nice salad with a good sized falafel. Friendly service. Total bill for two $16 plus tax and tip.  Worth a stop.

data.title: Not bad for Lunch or Dinner
data.text: Food was good and the portions were plentiful. We ate out on the Patio, but there is a large restaurant and Bar area around the side. I don't believe it is a franchise, but rather family owned and managed.

data.title: Great mediterranean food
data.text: Plenty of open space to sit on a comfortable Arizona evening.  The food was warm and well prepared.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.

data.title: OMG Amazing food. Sooo good
data.text: This place was transplanted directly from the Mediterranean to phoenix, Food was prepared in about 10 minutes and was extremely tasty and authentic, you're probably never going to want to eat hummus anywhere else again,This place has affordable and very delicious meats and food! Their service is fast and very honest people that work here. I love their chicken, All of the grilled meat is good as is the baba ganoush and hummus. Falafel is also really excellent.I ordered the Chicken Kebab plate with Tabouli and all was delicious. you'll love it! I'll keep coming back.

data.title: So-So...
data.text:
I've eaten at The Pita House on several occasions over the years.  Each time I go back, I'm reminded why I haven't been back sooner.  It isn't terrible, but it isn't very good either.  The food I've had here has generally been bland.  All the right ingredients are on the plate, but nothing stands out, and nothing brings those ingredients together.

This time I had the gyro salad.  The meat was just ok.  The lettuce was crisp.  The dressing was just boring.  I have never gotten the sense that anyone who works here cares.

data.title: Mediterranean Reataurants
data.text: Has chicken & beef Shawarma. Found the beef much more flavorful . Found hookahs at every table along with a tasty Lebanese beer. Have Option to sit outside and enjoy the open air or sit inside and enjoy the DJ.

data.title: The greek salad is good.
data.text: First of all, the location is very good, located in the old town of Scottsdale. I ordered a greek salad  and it was tasty and good value for money. The server was nice. It was an almost good experience and a good way to eat something else than a sandwich at low price.

data.title: Terribly SLOW
data.text: During lunch hour there is ONE guy taking care of the whole restaurant. He was running around trying to take care of the very few tables he had.  I waited 20+ min for a to go order of hummus and greek salad.  Food is ok.. but not worth the long wait.   Dont look into the kitchen there is a mirror on one of the walls that is filthy with grease.

data.title: Swarma and more.
data.text: We get take out. Always delicious. Love the smell at the restaurant. Great staff... Love the swarma and pitas.....

data.title: A disappointment
data.text: What a great location in Old Town!  We got in late from the airport and decided to walk from our hotel to see if anything was open.  We were drawn to the outside seating and the great view of passersby and we figured we couldn't go wrong with falafel but we were very wrong.  The falafel were dry and flavorless, as were the chicken kabobs.  The beef shawarma sandwich was a bit better.  All of the outside seating accommodates hookah smokers so there was no way for us to eat outside without the annoyingly sweet smell of hookah smoke.  Definitely a disappointment.

data.title: Worst Lunch we have had in ages
data.text: My husband and I have worked in this area for over 20 years.  Now, this place has only been here for a year or two, so this was our first try at it.  It was terrible.  The worst lunch we have had in ages.  The service was not good, the entire staff sat outside smoking a hookah pipe while customers ate.  When we arrived, no one was at the order counter, he had to come in from the hookah table outside just to take our order.  After waiting for over 25 minutes, our order finally came.  I had the chicken pita and my husband had the chicken kabob pita.  His was a little better than mine.  The chicken in my sandwich looked like the meat you get when you order a veggie burger and it had little to no taste.  All I could really taste was the char from the grill.  His kabob meat was a little better, looked like chicken at least, but had burnt mushrooms throughout.  While we were sitting there, a large delivery truck pulled up and plopped several cans of chicken meat on the dolly and headed inside.  Needless to say, we did not feel good about that.  I guess you live and learn, but that is it for us.  I will be surprised if they stay in business there, as this is a pretty high-rent district and there were 4 customers total for the entire lunch our.  Blah....

data.title: A Favorite for Mediterranean Food
data.text: This is one of my favorite places for Mediterranean food in Scottsdale.  The shawarma and falafel are delicious.  The chicken gyros are not my favorite here - they lack a bit of flavor for me, but the regular gyros are great.    The service can be a bit spotty and slow - but it's great to sit outside and people watch.  Oh, and they have hookah here - haven't tried it, but have seen lots of people enjoying.

data.title: Turkish Pitas not for me
data.text:
The location of the Pita House is hard to beat but I was less than impressed with the chicken gyro and salad that I had there. The salad was fresh and flavorful but the taste of the sandwich was overwhelmed by the spices they use - tasting more like a shawarma than a gyro. If you like Turkish food this place may appeal to you.

As I was in a hurry, this was a takeout meal. I did not really experience it but the dine- in area did not look appealing.

data.title: Great Spot for a very casual lunch
data.text: This is a great spot for a casual (and very healthy) lunch. It does a brisk takeout business but has about 10 tables outside at which you can sit and watch the people and traffic go by in Old Scottsdale. The food was excellent. We has a variety of dishes from the vegetarian plate to falafels and pitas, and without exception, every one of us thoroughly enjoyed lunch. A very nice girl behind the counter as well. (she does bring your food out to your table). We will go back many times I am sure.

data.title: Great food!
data.text:
After I found Pita House during a recent business trip to Scottsdale, I bought To Go food at least two more times while 
I was there.  I do not eat meat, and their vegetarian combo is excellent!

data.title: Good falafel
data.text: Unusual falafel sandwich as this one packed pickles, hummus and tahini into a rolled up pita bread. Great value for under 6 bucks as this was served with a small salad as well. The falafel balls were normal, not green colored, and that is important. Good lunch for takeout.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: I love this place. They have a strange little set up with a separate room for dining in the back, as well as a patio on the opposite side of the building for dining and hookah. Their hummus is creamy, the protein platter is fabulous for low carbers and super yum. The vegetarian plate is awesome... and the pitas are fab. We go in at least once a month, we meet a couple of vegan members of the family, and they can eat there as well.

data.title: Nice Mediterranean food
data.text: Having visited Greece, Turkey, Cyprus we weren't expecting to find a restaurant like this in Scottsdale. The food was great, however and the waitress was very helpful. The prices were reasonable and there was agood range to choose from.

data.title: Very nice shwarmas; did takeaways
data.text: Great staff at the take out counter. Great fos; nicely packaged for takeout. Reasonably priced.
